options.title: --binstubs[=<directory>]
options.description:
Binstubs are scripts that wrap around executables. Bundler creates a small Ruby file (a binstub) that loads Bundler, runs the command, and puts it in bin/. This lets you link the binstub inside of an application to the exact gem version the application needs.

Creates a directory (defaults to ~/bin) and places any executables from the gem there. These executables run in Bundler's context. If used, you might add this directory to your environment's PATH variable. For instance, if the rails gem comes with a rails executable, this flag will create a bin/rails executable that ensures that all referred dependencies will be resolved using the bundled gems.

options.title: --clean
options.description:
On finishing the installation Bundler is going to remove any gems not present in the current Gemfile(5). Don't worry, gems currently in use will not be removed.

This option is deprecated in favor of the clean setting.

options.title: --deployment
options.description:
In deployment mode, Bundler will 'roll-out' the bundle for production or CI use. Please check carefully if you want to have this option enabled in your development environment.

This option is deprecated in favor of the deployment setting.

options.title: --redownload
options.description: Force download every gem, even if the required versions are already available locally.

options.title: --frozen
options.description:
Do not allow the Gemfile.lock to be updated after this install. Exits non-zero if there are going to be changes to the Gemfile.lock.

This option is deprecated in favor of the frozen setting.

options.title: --full-index
options.description: Bundler will not call Rubygems' API endpoint (default) but download and cache a (currently big) index file of all gems. Performance can be improved for large bundles that seldom change by enabling this option.

options.title: --gemfile=<gemfile>
options.description: The location of the Gemfile(5) which Bundler should use. This defaults to a Gemfile(5) in the current working directory. In general, Bundler will assume that the location of the Gemfile(5) is also the project's root and will try to find Gemfile.lock and vendor/cache relative to this location.

options.title: --jobs=[<number>], -j[<number>]
options.description: The maximum number of parallel download and install jobs. The default is 1.

options.title: --jobs=[<number>], -j[<number>]
options.description: The maximum number of parallel download and install jobs. The default is 1.

options.title: --local
options.description: Do not attempt to connect to rubygems.org. Instead, Bundler will use the gems already present in Rubygems' cache or in vendor/cache. Note that if an appropriate platform-specific gem exists on rubygems.org it will not be found.

options.title: --no-cache
options.description: Do not update the cache in vendor/cache with the newly bundled gems. This does not remove any gems in the cache but keeps the newly bundled gems from being cached during the install.

options.title: --no-prune
options.description:
Don't remove stale gems from the cache when the installation finishes.

This option is deprecated in favor of the no_prune setting.

options.title: --path=<path>
options.description:
The location to install the specified gems to. This defaults to Rubygems' setting. Bundler shares this location with Rubygems, gem install ... will have gem installed there, too. Therefore, gems installed without a --path ... setting will show up by calling gem list. Accordingly, gems installed to other locations will not get listed.

This option is deprecated in favor of the path setting.

options.title: --quiet
options.description: Do not print progress information to the standard output. Instead, Bundler will exit using a status code ($?).

options.title: --retry=[<number>]
options.description: Retry failed network or git requests for number times.

options.title: --shebang=<ruby-executable>
options.description:
Uses the specified ruby executable (usually ruby) to execute the scripts created with --binstubs. In addition, if you use --binstubs together with --shebang jruby these executables will be changed to execute jruby instead.

This option is deprecated in favor of the shebang setting.

options.title: --standalone[=<list>]
options.description: Makes a bundle that can work without depending on Rubygems or Bundler at runtime. A space separated list of groups to install has to be specified. Bundler creates a directory named bundle and installs the bundle there. It also generates a bundle/bundler/setup.rb file to replace Bundler's own setup in the manner required. Using this option implicitly sets path, which is a [remembered option][REMEMBERED OPTIONS].

options.title: --system
options.description:
Installs the gems specified in the bundle to the system's Rubygems location. This overrides any previous configuration of --path.

This option is deprecated in favor of the system setting.

options.title: --trust-policy=[<policy>]
options.description: Apply the Rubygems security policy policy, where policy is one of HighSecurity, MediumSecurity, LowSecurity, AlmostNoSecurity, or NoSecurity. For more details, please see the Rubygems signing documentation linked below in SEE ALSO.

options.title: --with=<list>
options.description:
A space-separated list of groups referencing gems to install. If an optional group is given it is installed. If a group is given that is in the remembered list of groups given to --without, it is removed from that list.

This option is deprecated in favor of the with setting.

options.title: --without=<list>
options.description:
A space-separated list of groups referencing gems to skip during installation. If a group is given that is in the remembered list of groups given to --with, it is removed from that list.

This option is deprecated in favor of the without setting.

options.title: --all
options.description: Update all gems specified in Gemfile.

options.title: --group=<name>, -g=[<name>]
options.description: Only update the gems in the specified group. For instance, you can update all gems in the development group with bundle update --group development. You can also call bundle update rails --group test to update the rails gem and all gems in the test group, for example.

options.title: --group=<name>, -g=[<name>]
options.description: Only update the gems in the specified group. For instance, you can update all gems in the development group with bundle update --group development. You can also call bundle update rails --group test to update the rails gem and all gems in the test group, for example.

options.title: --source=<name>
options.description: The name of a :git or :path source used in the Gemfile(5). For instance, with a :git source of http://github.com/rails/rails.git, you would call bundle update --source rails

options.title: --local
options.description: Do not attempt to fetch gems remotely and use the gem cache instead.

options.title: --ruby
options.description: Update the locked version of Ruby to the current version of Ruby.

options.title: --bundler
options.description: Update the locked version of bundler to the invoked bundler version.

options.title: --full-index
options.description: Fall back to using the single-file index of all gems.

options.title: --jobs=[<number>], -j[<number>]
options.description: Specify the number of jobs to run in parallel. The default is 1.

options.title: --jobs=[<number>], -j[<number>]
options.description: Specify the number of jobs to run in parallel. The default is 1.

options.title: --retry=[<number>]
options.description: Retry failed network or git requests for number times.

options.title: --quiet
options.description: Only output warnings and errors.

options.title: --redownload
options.description: Force downloading every gem.

options.title: --patch
options.description: Prefer updating only to next patch version.

options.title: --minor
options.description: Prefer updating only to next minor version.

options.title: --major
options.description: Prefer updating to next major version (default).

options.title: --strict
options.description: Do not allow any gem to be updated past latest --patch | --minor | --major.

options.title: --conservative
options.description: Use bundle install conservative update behavior and do not allow indirect dependencies to be updated.

options.title: --keep-file-descriptors
options.description: Exec in Ruby 2.0 began discarding non-standard file descriptors. When this flag is passed, exec will revert to the 1.9 behaviour of passing all file descriptors to the new process.

options.title: --no-color
options.description: Print all output without color

options.title: --retry, -r
options.description: Specify the number of times you wish to attempt network commands

options.title: --retry, -r
options.description: Specify the number of times you wish to attempt network commands

options.title: --verbose, -V
options.description: Print out additional logging information

options.title: --verbose, -V
options.description: Print out additional logging information

options.title: --version, -v
options.description: Specify version requirements(s) for the added gem.

options.title: --version, -v
options.description: Specify version requirements(s) for the added gem.

options.title: --group, -g
options.description: Specify the group(s) for the added gem. Multiple groups should be separated by commas.

options.title: --group, -g
options.description: Specify the group(s) for the added gem. Multiple groups should be separated by commas.

options.title: --source, -s
options.description: Specify the source for the added gem.

options.title: --source, -s
options.description: Specify the source for the added gem.

options.title: --git
options.description: Specify the git source for the added gem.

options.title: --branch
options.description: Specify the git branch for the added gem.

options.title: --skip-install
options.description: Adds the gem to the Gemfile but does not install it.

options.title: --optimistic
options.description: Adds optimistic declaration of version

options.title: --strict
options.description: Adds strict declaration of version

options.title: --force
options.description: Overwrite existing binstubs if they exist.

options.title: --path
options.description: The location to install the specified binstubs to. This defaults to bin.

options.title: --standalone
options.description: Makes binstubs that can work without depending on Rubygems or Bundler at runtime.

options.title: --shebang
options.description: Specify a different shebang executable name than the default (default 'ruby')

options.title: --all
options.description: Create binstubs for all gems in the bundle.

options.title: --dry-run
options.description: Locks the Gemfile(5) before running the command.

options.title: --gemfile
options.description: Use the specified gemfile instead of the Gemfile(5).

options.title: --path
options.description: Specify a different path than the system default ($BUNDLE_PATH or $GEM_HOME). Bundler will remember this value for future installs on this machine.

options.title: --dry-run
options.description: Print the changes, but do not clean the unused gems.

options.title: --force
options.description: Force a clean even if --path is not set.

options.title: --quiet
options.description: Only output warnings and errors.

options.title: --gemfile=<gemfile>
options.description: The location of the Gemfile(5) which Bundler should use. This defaults to a Gemfile(5) in the current working directory. In general, Bundler will assume that the location of the Gemfile(5) is also the project's root and will try to find Gemfile.lock and vendor/cache relative to this location.

options.title: --exe or -b or --bin
options.description: Specify that Bundler should create a binary executable (as exe/GEM_NAME) in the generated rubygem project. This binary will also be added to the GEM_NAME.gemspec manifest. This behavior is disabled by default.

options.title: --exe or -b or --bin
options.description: Specify that Bundler should create a binary executable (as exe/GEM_NAME) in the generated rubygem project. This binary will also be added to the GEM_NAME.gemspec manifest. This behavior is disabled by default.

options.title: --exe or -b or --bin
options.description: Specify that Bundler should create a binary executable (as exe/GEM_NAME) in the generated rubygem project. This binary will also be added to the GEM_NAME.gemspec manifest. This behavior is disabled by default.

options.title: --no-exe
options.description: Do not create a binary (overrides --exe specified in the global config).

options.title: --coc
options.description: Add a CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md file to the root of the generated project. If this option is unspecified, an interactive prompt will be displayed and the answer will be saved in Bundler's global config for future bundle gem use.

options.title: --no-coc
options.description: Do not create a CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md (overrides --coc specified in the global config).

options.title: --ext
options.description: Add boilerplate for C extension code to the generated project. This behavior is disabled by default.

options.title: --no-ext
options.description: Do not add C extension code (overrides --ext specified in the global config).

options.title: --mit
options.description: Add an MIT license to a LICENSE.txt file in the root of the generated project. Your name from the global git config is used for the copyright statement. If this option is unspecified, an interactive prompt will be displayed and the answer will be saved in Bundler's global config for future bundle gem use.

options.title: --no-mit
options.description: Do not create a LICENSE.txt (overrides --mit specified in the global config).

options.title: -t, --test=minitest, --test=rspec, --test=test-unit
options.description:
Specify the test framework that Bundler should use when generating the project. Acceptable values are minitest, rspec and test-unit. The GEM_NAME.gemspec will be configured and a skeleton test/spec directory will be created based on this option. Given no option is specified:

When Bundler is configured to generate tests, this defaults to Bundler's global config setting gem.test.

When Bundler is configured to not generate tests, an interactive prompt will be displayed and the answer will be used for the current rubygem project.

When Bundler is unconfigured, an interactive prompt will be displayed and the answer will be saved in Bundler's global config for future bundle gem use.

options.title: -t, --test=minitest, --test=rspec, --test=test-unit
options.description:
Specify the test framework that Bundler should use when generating the project. Acceptable values are minitest, rspec and test-unit. The GEM_NAME.gemspec will be configured and a skeleton test/spec directory will be created based on this option. Given no option is specified:

When Bundler is configured to generate tests, this defaults to Bundler's global config setting gem.test.

When Bundler is configured to not generate tests, an interactive prompt will be displayed and the answer will be used for the current rubygem project.

When Bundler is unconfigured, an interactive prompt will be displayed and the answer will be saved in Bundler's global config for future bundle gem use.

options.title: --ci, --ci=github, --ci=travis, --ci=gitlab, --ci=circle
options.description:
Specify the continuous integration service that Bundler should use when generating the project. Acceptable values are github, travis, gitlab and circle. A configuration file will be generated in the project directory. Given no option is specified:

When Bundler is configured to generate CI files, this defaults to Bundler's global config setting gem.ci.

When Bundler is configured to not generate CI files, an interactive prompt will be displayed and the answer will be used for the current rubygem project.

When Bundler is unconfigured, an interactive prompt will be displayed and the answer will be saved in Bundler's global config for future bundle gem use.

options.title: -e, --edit[=EDITOR]
options.description: Open the resulting GEM_NAME.gemspec in EDITOR, or the default editor if not specified. The default is $BUNDLER_EDITOR, $VISUAL, or $EDITOR.

options.title: -e, --edit[=EDITOR]
options.description: Open the resulting GEM_NAME.gemspec in EDITOR, or the default editor if not specified. The default is $BUNDLER_EDITOR, $VISUAL, or $EDITOR.

options.title: --path
options.description: Print the path of the given gem

options.title: --gemspec
options.description: Use the specified .gemspec to create the Gemfile(5)

options.title: --name-only
options.description: Print only the name of each gem.

options.title: --paths
options.description: Print the path to each gem in the bundle.

options.title: --without-group=<list>
options.description: A space-separated list of groups of gems to skip during printing.

options.title: --only-group=<list>
options.description: A space-separated list of groups of gems to print.

options.title: --update=<*gems>
options.description: Ignores the existing lockfile. Resolve then updates lockfile. Taking a list of gems or updating all gems if no list is given.

options.title: --local
options.description: Do not attempt to connect to rubygems.org. Instead, Bundler will use the gems already present in Rubygems' cache or in vendor/cache. Note that if a appropriate platform-specific gem exists on rubygems.org it will not be found.

options.title: --print
options.description: Prints the lockfile to STDOUT instead of writing to the file system.

options.title: --lockfile=<path>
options.description: The path where the lockfile should be written to.

options.title: --full-index
options.description: Fall back to using the single-file index of all gems.

options.title: --add-platform
options.description: Add a new platform to the lockfile, re-resolving for the addition of that platform.

options.title: --remove-platform
options.description: Remove a platform from the lockfile.

options.title: --patch
options.description: If updating, prefer updating only to next patch version.

options.title: --minor
options.description: If updating, prefer updating only to next minor version.

options.title: --major
options.description: If updating, prefer updating to next major version (default).

options.title: --strict
options.description: If updating, do not allow any gem to be updated past latest --patch | --minor | --major.

options.title: --conservative
options.description: If updating, use bundle install conservative update behavior and do not allow shared dependencies to be updated.

options.title: --local
options.description: Do not attempt to fetch gems remotely and use the gem cache instead.

options.title: --pre
options.description: Check for newer pre-release gems.

options.title: --source
options.description: Check against a specific source.

options.title: --strict
options.description: Only list newer versions allowed by your Gemfile requirements.

options.title: --parseable, --porcelain
options.description: Use minimal formatting for more parseable output.

options.title: --parseable, --porcelain
options.description: Use minimal formatting for more parseable output.

options.title: --group
options.description: List gems from a specific group.

options.title: --groups
options.description: List gems organized by groups.

options.title: --update-strict
options.description: Strict conservative resolution, do not allow any gem to be updated past latest --patch | --minor| --major.

options.title: --minor
options.description: Prefer updating only to next minor version.

options.title: --major
options.description: Prefer updating to next major version (default).

options.title: --patch
options.description: Prefer updating only to next patch version.

options.title: --filter-major
options.description: Only list major newer versions.

options.title: --filter-minor
options.description: Only list minor newer versions.

options.title: --filter-patch
options.description: Only list patch newer versions.

options.title: --only-explicit
options.description: Only list gems specified in your Gemfile, not their dependencies.

options.title: --ruby
options.description: It will display the ruby directive information, so you don't have to parse it from the Gemfile(5).

options.title: --install
options.description: Runs bundle install after the given gems have been removed from the Gemfile, which ensures that both the lockfile and the installed gems on disk are also updated to remove the given gem(s).

options.title: --paths
options.description: List the paths of all gems that are required by your Gemfile(5), sorted by gem name.

options.title: --file, -f
options.description: The name to use for the generated file. See --format option

options.title: --file, -f
options.description: The name to use for the generated file. See --format option

options.title: --format, -F
options.description: This is output format option. Supported format is png, jpg, svg, dot ...

options.title: --format, -F
options.description: This is output format option. Supported format is png, jpg, svg, dot ...

options.title: --requirements, -R
options.description: Set to show the version of each required dependency.

options.title: --requirements, -R
options.description: Set to show the version of each required dependency.

options.title: --version, -v
options.description: Set to show each gem version.

options.title: --version, -v
options.description: Set to show each gem version.

options.title: --without, -W
options.description: Exclude gems that are part of the specified named group.

options.description: Exclude gems that are part of the specified named group.
